title: Are all freshers in Cognizant initially PAT? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes. For freshers who are from B Tech(Similar degrees) and MCA background , the designation will be PAT. And after 1 year probation period, becomes Programmer Analyst.  For freshers from BSc or BCA and its equivalent background, Designation would be Programmer Trainee and becomes Programmer after 1 year. And later depending on performance, it takes 2-4 years to become programmer analyst.

No! Generally engineering graduates are designated PAT and other under graduates (BSc, BCA, etc) are designated PT.  So the evolution is: (PT) ->(P)/PAT ->PA ->A ->SA ->PM ->SM ->AD -> D -> SD ... it goes on. If you are from IIT you become A straight away!  This hold true for software development only. Other areas such as ITIS, BPO may have different designations.

If you are fresher that means you will have to undergo training. If you are undergoing a training, you are a Trainee. Its that simple. For one year you will be Programmer Analyst Trainee (PAT) and then upon review from your HCM Supervisor you will be promoted to Programmer Analyst (PA).
